title: Ch35t Schema
description: Chests as defined in the Ch35t format

label.description: A label attached to the chest, containing information about it

URI.description: A Uniform Resource Identifier for the chest (can match the URL it can be downloaded from

author.description: The email address of the chest creator (often used in conjuction with a signature

hint.description: A hint that might help you find the key to open the chest

origin.description: A Uniform Resource Identifier for the hint (can match the URL it can be downloaded from)

data.description: The hint contents (plain text or base64-encoded binary)

format.description: The format (mime-type) of the hint contents. Note that we currently allow only formats for which we have a handler, but this is not strictly necessary (i.e. we can just save files we do not know how to handle and allow players to deal with them)

if.description: If origin URL is provided with no data, we currently require a format to be specified (i.e. we do not assume text/plain default as we do with data)

origin.description: A Uniform Resource Identifier for the payload (can match the URL it can be downloaded from)

data.description: The hint contents (plain text or base64-encoded binary)

format.description: The format (mime-type) of the payload contents. Note that we currently allow only formats for which we have a handler, but this is not strictly necessary (i.e. we can just save files we do not know how to handle and allow players to deal with them)

output-format.description: The format (mime-type) of the decrypted payload. Note that as we do not necessarily need to handle this, we leave the possibility of using any format here.

method.description: The encryption method used to conceal the payload

name.description: The name of the encryption method

args.description: Extra arguments to be provided to the method handler
